text: Thailand was first at the Olympic Games in 1952. They have been in every Summer Olympic Games since then. They were not in the 1980 Summer Olympics. Thailand has been in the Winter Olympic Games since 2002. Only one person, Prawat Nagvajara, has competed for Thailand in the Winter Olympics. Thai athletes have won a total of twenty-one medals, mostly in boxing. In 2008 Thailand won 8 medals, their best so far. The National Olympic Committee for Thailand was formed in 1948 and recognized in 1950. ==Medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event 1976 Montreal Boxing Men's light flyweight 1984 Los Angeles Boxing Men's light welterweight 1988 Seoul Boxing Men's bantamweight 1992 Barcelona Boxing Men's welterweight 1996 Atlanta Boxing Men's featherweight 1996 Atlanta Boxing Men's bantamweight 2000 Sydney Boxing Men's flyweight 2000 Sydney Boxing Men's light middleweight 2000 Sydney Weightlifting Women's 58 kg 2004 Athens Boxing Men's light welterweight 2004 Athens Weightlifting Women's 53 kg 2004 Athens Weightlifting Women's 75 kg 2004 Athens Boxing Men's bantamweight 2004 Athens Boxing Men's middleweight 2004 Athens Taekwondo Women's 49 kg 2004 Athens Weightlifting Women's 48 kg 2004 Athens Weightlifting Women's 58 kg 2008 Beijing Weightlifting Women's 53 kg 2008 Beijing Boxing Flyweight 2008 Beijing Taekwondo Women's 49 kg 2008 Beijing Boxing Light welterweight 2012 London Weightlifting Women's 58 kg 2012 London Boxing Men's light flyweight 2012 London Taekwondo Women's 49 kg ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== ==Other websites== * Thailand profile at London2012.com Category:Sport in Thailand Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Thailand
title: Thailand at the Olympics
